definition: to understand (by hearing)/to catch (what sb says)
(literary pronunciation, still advocated in Taiwan) to rule/to sentence/to allow
to listen/to hear/to obey/a can (loanword from English "tin")/classifier for canned beverages
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
to understand/to comprehend

sentences.english: People in many countries can understand English songs.
sentences.chinese: 很多國家的人們都聽得懂英文歌曲。

sentences.english: He slurred English. No man could understand him.
sentences.chinese: 他含糊不清地說着英語，沒人能聽得懂他說的是什麼。

sentences.english: Can you make out what he is saying?
sentences.chinese: 他在說什麼，你能聽得懂嗎？
我說的臺語你聽得懂喔？

sentences.english: Which of these mortal hearts understands raillery ?
sentences.chinese: 這些凡人的心，有誰聽得懂玩笑？

sentences.english: And they did not know that Joseph understood, for there was an interpreter between them.
sentences.chinese: 他們不知道約瑟聽得懂，因爲在他們中間有傳譯的人。

sentences.english: If you speak slowly, I understand.
No one understood what this meant, and, intruth, neither did we.
sentences.chinese: 沒人聽得懂這是什麼意思，說實話，我倆也不懂。
沒有人能聽得懂他在說些什麼。

sentences.english: "I got every word," says the parrot.

definition: unable to make sense of what one is hearing
